What it is: Rewrites how you process and react to shame as a signal.
How to use it: Describe a moment you felt shame. Ask AI what the shame might be trying to protect or instruct.
What it changes: Turns shame into a directional tool instead of a stop sign.

What it is: Distinguishes what emotions or thoughts are yours vs. absorbed from others.
How to use it: Describe your internal state after socializing. Ask AI to filter borrowed energy or narratives.
What it changes: Protects identity coherence and reduces emotional entanglement.

What it is: Identifies broken feedback cycles in motivation.
How to use it: Describe a project you're avoiding. Ask AI what false reward loops or mismatched feedback mechanisms may be involved.
What it changes: Recalibrates intrinsic vs. extrinsic motivation triggers.

What it is: Tests whether your current beliefs or fears are based on fact, memory, or distortion.
How to use it: Describe a belief or fear. Ask AI to classify its origin: data, experience, projection, or avoidance.
What it changes: Improves epistemic hygiene and reduces anxiety from illusion.

What it is: Translates the feeling of being stuck into actionable insight.
How to use it: Describe a life area you feel numb or static in. Ask AI what the stuckness is trying to signal or protect.
What it changes: Restores movement and meaning where entropy has set in.

What it is: Quantifies how much vulnerability you’re emotionally budgeting for key relationships.
How to use it: List your core relationships. Ask AI to model how much risk or honesty each one can withstand.
What it changes: Optimizes emotional investments and expands intimacy literacy.

What it is: Breaks down compulsive behavior into root needs and avoidances.
How to use it: Describe a compulsion. Ask AI to simulate its full emotional, cognitive, and symbolic architecture.
What it changes: Reveals the unmet need inside behavioral loops.

What it is: Predictive model for your psychological and emotional growth timeline.
How to use it: Describe your current healing focus. Ask AI to estimate potential shifts at 1 month, 3 months, 1 year.
What it changes: Builds long-range emotional strategy and sustains motivation.

What it is: Analyzes the meaning structure of what you consume (media, food, aesthetics).
How to use it: List your recent choices. Ask AI to decode the hidden themes or needs driving them.
What it changes: Turns consumption into an act of self-reflection.

What it is: Detects where you're feeding on fantasy instead of facts.
How to use it: Describe something you’re waiting for. Ask AI what part of it is avoidant wishful thinking.
What it changes: Shifts agency from delay to action by collapsing illusion.
